# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

In Julia, you can solve the problem with the following function:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

You can test this function with an example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nunc rutrum turpis et ultricies porttitor."))
```
